brief_summary.textblock:
The effectiveness of clinic-based pulmonary rehabilitation in advanced Chronic Obstructive
      Pulmonary Disease (COPD) is well established, but few data exist for less severe patients
      treated in alternative settings.  The purpose of this study was to investigate whether a
      novel, community-based exercise program was feasible and effective for patients with
      moderate COPD.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Controlled Study of Community-based Exercise Training in Patients With Moderate COPD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with moderate COPD and self-reported exercise impairment

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  current smokers, pulmonary diseases other than COPD, use of supplemental oxygen,
             musculoskeletal disease that impaired exercise performance and unstable coronary
             artery disease or congestive heart failure

clinical_study.official_title: A Controlled Study of Community-based Exercise Training in Patients With Moderate COPD

oversight_info.authority: United States: Data and Safety Monitoring Board

primary_outcome.description: Change in endurance of physical activity was measured in seconds.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in muscle strength was measures in pounds of weight lifted

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
